definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

sentences.english: I’m the black sheep of my family, in that sense, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 從這一點上說，我可能是家族的叛逆者，”她說。

sentences.english: Though never rebellious, he sometimes bristled at being given too many directions.
sentences.chinese: 雖然從不叛逆，但有時，他會對過多的命令發怒。

sentences.english: In the rebel s universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡頌揚不公。

sentences.english: Is uneasy again to divide, even if sit the contumacy of the heart bottom in uneasy cent also.
sentences.chinese: 再就是不安分，即使坐着也不安分的心底的叛逆性。

sentences.english: Chapter four devotes mainly to the treachery characteristic.
sentences.chinese: 第四章分析網絡文學的叛逆性特點。

sentences.english: In someone's opinions, the keyboard becomes a medium of expression for the young writer's rebelliousness.
sentences.chinese: 在一些人看來，網絡成了年輕寫手彰顯叛逆的媒介。

sentences.english: The rebel spirit of Gao Xingjian is valuable wealth.
sentences.chinese: 高行健的叛逆精神是寶貴的財富。

sentences.english: When an artist deserts to the side of the angels it is the most odious of treasons.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家投合傳統派的觀點，便是最可惡的叛逆行爲。

sentences.english: Zhu Wei is proudly defiant about his approach to ink painting.
sentences.chinese: 朱偉對自己的水墨畫帶有叛逆性的自豪。

sentences.english: Out. I Just want to get lost in the Darkness…
sentences.chinese: 想着想着，覺得這叛逆心理愈增愈烈了。

sentences.english: Outwardly, I was everything a well-brought up girl should be. Inside, I was screaming.
sentences.chinese: 表面上，我是個有教養的女孩子，內在，我很叛逆。

sentences.english: For if it prosper, none dare call it treason.
sentences.chinese: 因爲長盛不衰就沒有人敢稱之爲叛逆。

sentences.english: The popularity of this man from Shanghai illustrates vividly the rebellious mood of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 楊佳的受歡迎生動描繪了中國人民的叛逆情緒。

sentences.english: Junior students are in the period of physiological growth but psychological treason.
sentences.chinese: 初中生正處在生理的發育期，心理的叛逆期。

sentences.english: In the rebels universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡頌揚不公。

sentences.english: My rebellious years started from high school.
sentences.chinese: 我的青春叛逆期是從高中的時候開始的。

definition: to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
(physiognomy) protruding bone at the back of the head, regarded as a sign of a renegade nature
